result.execSummary:
All charges against Jeremy K Kvamme in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy K Kvamme is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy K Kvamme

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeremy K Kvamme appeared by phone.  Attorney Wynes appeared by video, making a special appearance for Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson  for Jeremy K Kvamme.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Wynes is heard and states the request of the defendant. 

Atty Steiner is heard and take no position. 

Court does not grant defendants request.  Request denied. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders defendant to report to the jail as previously scheduled.

10:39 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jeremy K Kvamme in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jeremy K Kvamme.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard on sentence agreement. Defendant to plead to counts 2/4/5. The rest of the counts dismissed but read in.  All traffic cases to be dismissed and the new case 22CF85 bail jumping to be dismissed. 120 days jail plus costs. 90 days jail plus costs. Sentences to run consecutive. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews elements with the defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the min/max penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant entered a no contest plea. Court finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily entered pleas. Court accepts the defendants no contest pleas and finds the defendant guilty. 

State is heard on sentence. State recommends all traffic matters to be dismissed, 22CF85 to be dismissed. Cts 1/3/6 dismissed but read-in. 
120 days jail plus costs. 90 days jail plus costs. Sentences to run consecutive. 

Atty Erickson is heard on sentence. Requests probation and EM. 

Defendant is heard. Requests probation and treatment. 

Court orders all traffic matters to be dismissed, 22CF85 to be dismissed. Counts 1/3/6 dismissed but read in. 
Jail sentence stayed...defendant to report on or before but no later than July 20th @ 6:30 PM.  Defendant entitled to good time. Defendant may transfer to another county. 
Ct2 - 20 day jail. Huber and EM approved after the first 48 hours served. Fine of $450.00. Total w/cost and surcharges = $1,105.00. Blood Draw fee $120.00. DL Rev of 14 mo. IID- 1 yr when DL is issued. 
2 days jail credit. 
Ct4 - 120 days jail, consecutive.
Ct5 - 90 days jail, consecutive. 
DNA waived on cts 4 and 5. 
Payment plan approved. $30.00 pr mo commencing September 1st, 2022. $15.00 PPF.
